intro: Diaphananthe fimbriata, commonly known as the fimbriate diaphananthe, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in swampy or wetland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
